    • Method Detail

      • getServoPulseWidth

        public int getServoPulseWidth()
        Description copied from interface: ServoDriver
        This method returns current servo pulse width. Zero may represent this driver stopped producing pulses. Also, value of -1 may define undefined situation when this abstraction didn't get initial value yet and there is no way telling what real, hardware or software driver is sending.
        Specified by:
        getServoPulseWidth in interface ServoDriver
        Returns:
        current servo pulse this driver is producing

      • setServoPulseWidth

        public void setServoPulseWidth(int width)
        Description copied from interface: ServoDriver
        Sets servo pulse width in resolution provided by ServoDriver.getServoPulseResolution(). Zero value may mean that this driver is currently not producing pulse. Negative values may, generally, be invalid.
        Specified by:
        setServoPulseWidth in interface ServoDriver
        Parameters:
        width - pulse width in resolution read from ServoDriver.getServoPulseResolution()

      • getServoPulseResolution

        public int getServoPulseResolution()
        Description copied from interface: ServoDriver
        This is read only value driver is to provide to users of this class. It defines resolution ServoDriver.getServoPulseWidth() and ServoDriver.setServoPulseWidth(int) methods are operating in. Resolution is provided in 1/n (ms) where value returned from this method is n.
        Specified by:
        getServoPulseResolution in interface ServoDriver
        Returns:
        resolution of servo pulse widths used in this interface

      • getPin

        public Pin getPin()
        Specified by:
        getPin in interface ServoDriver
